conversations.content: Inner tube prepped and ready!
Barbecue's all loaded up to go, too! Grillmaster Ranzal's gonna open y'all a portal to the meat dimension!
Going on vacation, I take it?
Aren't you going to join us, Alex? It's sure to be a good time.
I... I'm just not sure I have any business cavorting around like that.
You're not that girl who used to live in the darkness anymore. Show yourself grace.
...You know what? You're right.
I think I WILL go and have some summer fun with you all this year.
(Elisanne's right. I'm not who I used to be. Surely I can loosen up at least a little.)
(Here's to a fun-filled getaway with my dear friend—the one who pulled me back into the light!)
However... Something else awaited Alex on the sun-kissed sands of the beach.
Eee! Alex!
Whoa, I've heard about her!
I saw you, Alex! You were AMAZING!
(Hrk... So much for a relaxing trip!)
(I guess that incident brought down a little too much attention...)
...Huh? Help with an event?
A contest that Verica once participated in, to be specific.
That's right. It's a pageant of sorts to determine whose beauty rivals that of the sea itself.
I won't be joining in this time around, but I figured I might know some of the entrants. When I went to say hello, though, I could tell something was amiss.
Evidently, one of the people running the event suddenly took ill, and now they're shorthanded.
I wish I could help, but my schedule is full up with my fortune-telling work.
I see. I'd be happy to pitch in, then.
So all I need to do is distribute ballots to each spectator, and then collect them? Sounds simple enough.
And now, at long last, we come to the climactic finale of our grand contest! Dear spectators and distinguished lookers- on, are your ballots ready?!
Time to get to work. ...Everyone, you can just hand your ballots to me, and—
Aaaaagh! There're fiends coming from the ocean!
What?!
Eeeeek! Somebody heeelp!
Haaah!
Tch. Couldn't finish it off with just my self-defense knife.
But if one strike isn't enough...then I'll land another! Hrah! Yah! Hiiiyah!
Ladies and gentlemen, are you seeing this?! A staffer of this very contest has gallantly laid low the aquatic menace!
Uh... Why's there so much commotion?
As elegant as a swan...if swans carried knives! She fought with grace and splendor, leaving us all utterly bewitched!
Thank you, Alex! The contest is saved because of you!
Oh, er... I didn't do anything special.
Now, then! With the heat of enthusiasm still burning in our hearts, we continue our contest! Everyone, if you would be so kind as to prepare your votes?
Now I can finally do my job. Everyone, please hand me your ballots.
You were AWESOME! Thank you, Alex!
Um, you're welcome...
You're amazing! Team Alex all the way!
Since when do I have a fan club?!
At long last, vote tabulation is COMPLETE! And now, the news you've ALL been waiting for.
Why, what's this?! The honored first-place winner of our contest this year iiiiis...
ALEEEEEX!
WHAT?! I didn't even enter!
You certainly did not, but the people have spoken! The sight of you bravely facing off against evil was a spectacle worthy of our great contest!
Well then, how about this? We'll treat the second-place winner as the champion, and confer a special bonus prize to the illustrious Alex!
This is all happening so fast.
I'm turning red from all these people staring at me...
You're quite the local celebrity, Alex.
Can't say I'm enjoying it. I've never been in the spotlight quite like this before.
Ain't no wonder. For an assassin who lived her life lurkin' in the shadows, this kinda heat must be unbearable.
Hey, Alex! Can I have your autograph?
My AUTOGRAPH?!
Hrk... I'm sorry! I can't take this anymore!
Whoa! Alex?!
(How am I supposed to deal with all this?)
(So much for my peaceful vacation with Elisanne...)
*sigh* I've had it up to here with all this attention. I just need to hide a little until all the hubbub dies down.
Urgh, but on the other hand, I came here to have a vacation with Elisanne...
I guess I'll have to find someplace we can relax without people hounding us.
Well, well. Ain't she the one who swept this year's contest? Looks like she's off sulking by her lonesome. Heh. Lucky me.
Hey there. What's got your goat?
...Can I help you?
I couldn't help but notice that frown on your beautiful face. You get separated from your friends?
No. I wanted some alone time, actually.
Aw, where's the fun in that? How's about I take you someplace nice instead?
I know a good spot that's perfectly hidden away from prying eyes. Heh heh heh!
(He seems fairly knowledgeable.)
(I may as well take him up on his offer and see if it's somewhere I can take Elisanne.)
I'd appreciate that. Lead the way.
Atta girl! Follow me.
Here we are. Head right on inside, milady!
...What am I looking at?
Stop, please!
Hee hee hee! Kinda your fault for blindly following me, lady.
Only because you told me my friends were here!
Did I? Can't say I remember. Ha ha ha!
You are about to be in a world of hurt if you don't leave her alone. Back off.
Come on now, don't be like that. I bet you and I could get along reeeal nicely.
What the hell are you talking about?
Oh, y'know! A little of this, a little of that...
Alex!
Elisanne?! What are you doing here?
I couldn't find you, and then I saw you leave with that suspicious-looking man.
I was worried you might've gotten mixed up with some smooth-talking pickup artist...and I was right.
A pickup what, now?
Men who sweet-talk women into sharing their company. If it ended there, that'd be one thing...
But among them are vile cowards who try to force women to do things they don't want to do—like these men here.
Now I see what's happening here. We're dealing with some grade-A scoundrels.
Perfect. That means I don't have to pull my punches. PREPARE YOURSELVES!
Huh...?
We're sorry!
Punishment comes swiftly for the wicked. You'd better learn from this and think on what you've done.
Thank you for that. You saved me again.
I saved you before?
Yes! During the contest...
Aaaaagh! There're fiends coming from the ocean!
What?!
Eeeeek! Somebody heeelp!
Haaah!
Oh, right! You were one of the contestants!
I was. I'm SO grateful for what you did.
The sight of you fighting so brilliantly hasn't left my mind since. I'd actually hoped I'd see you again.
It's gotta be fate that our paths crossed again, don't you think?
Um, I'm not sure I—
I... I love you, Alex!
You what?!
I want nothing more than to be swaddled next to your protective bosom! PLEASE!
I... I'm sorry, but I don't think that's something I can do.
My heart's already set on someone. Her name is Elisanne.
What are you TALKING ABOUT?! Don't joke like that, Alex!
Who said it was a joke? I'm serious.
Alex... I see...
If that's how it's to be...then I wish you two the best. Farewell!
Huh?! No, hey, wait! I can't... I mean, she...!
What's got you so agitated?
You know exactly what!
Er... Do I?
All I said was that I'm not going to be protecting anybody other than you.
...Huh?
My heart is set on it. That's why I can't promise to look after anyone else.
Oh. So that's what you meant. Honestly...
*sigh* All this excitement has me beat.
Yeah. Right there with you.
Shall we go take a breather? I know just the spot.
Sure. And this time, I won't have to worry where I'm being taken...unlike with certain miscreants.
Welcome! Right this way, ladies!
Oh, Elisanne and Alex! Come in and take a load off.
So this is the cafe I've heard about.
It's the perfect seaside hideaway. Cold drinks and scrumptious snacks abound.
I'll take your word on that. We might have another problem on our hands, though...
Hey, that woman there... Is that...?
Yeah, the special winner of the contest.
People are staring at me.
My apologies. I suppose it was foolish to hope we'd escape notice someplace this populated.
My kingdom for a place we can relax without a million eyes on us. *sigh*
I'd heard the rumors, but wow. You really are the name on everyone's lips, Alex.
I bet if you were to be our barker, we could DOUBLE our sales!
Excuse you! What am I, chopped liver?
Huh? No, that's not what I—
I can't believe this! I have my pride! Are you forgetting who worked her tail off last summer to help this place thrive?
You know what? Let's make a little game out of this, Alex. You and I will compete to prove which of us makes a better barker!
Hey, I didn't consent to—
Two ladies stand before me, but only ONE can take home the title of the Best Barker in the Business!
Oho ho ho! My business senses are telling me we're sitting on a gold mine here! Alex, will you rise to Amane's challenge?
You're on board with this too?!
There's something in it for you, naturally. If you win, I'll let you borrow my villa.
And said villa comes with a private beach! We're talking 24-hour access to surf and turf without any pesky rubberneckers!
Okay, NOW I'm interested.
Let's do this.
Are you sure, Alex? This sounds like a surefire way to attract even more attention.
You're not wrong... But I'm ready for it.
I came to the beach specifically so you and I could have a vacation together.
I can conquer this particular mountain if it means you and I actually get to do that!
...Okay, Alex. Go get 'em.
The rules are simple: whoever brings in more customers within the time limit wins the title of Best Barker in the Business!
And with that...BEGIN!
(I'll need to devise a strategy here...)
Well, if it isn't our winner, Alex! What are you up to?
Hello. I remember you from the contest. I'm, er, working as a barker for the cafe over there for...reasons.
Well, fancy that. Sounds like I'd better drop by!
You serious?! Alex is working at that cafe? I don't need much more convincing than that to check it out!
That's fame for ya. She's bringing folks in by the boatload just by standing here.
Now, let's have a look at her competition...
Aha, you're here! This way, everyone!
Hee hee hee. All my dragon buds turned out for me!
Good hustle, Amane, but I'm afraid it's not valid if you just call in friends as a favor.
You need to attract customers like a proper barker would.
I'm well aware of that. My plan doesn't end there. Look closely!
Welcome, welcome, one and all! Come on down and dine with DRAGONS while you beat the summer heat!
Whoa, Siren's there? You're tellin' me I could kick back while gazing at that beautiful idol dragon?! That RULES!
Look how cute that round white dragon is! I wanna eat here, big sis!
Well, would you look at that? Okay. Let's check it out.
A bold strategy! No complaints from me, then. Lots of points for you, Amane!
You see that, Alex? That's what EXPERIENCE in this biz gets you!
I'm going to lose at this rate... I need a new plan of attack, and fast!
Let me give you some insider advice, Alex.
The key to turning things around is ADDED VALUE. You know, fanservice with a smile!
Entertain the customers who come to visit. Word of mouth will get around, and even more folks will start showing just for you!
I follow the logic, but, er... I don't exactly have the sunniest disposition, you know?
...Actually, wait. This is no time to hem and haw. Nothing to it but to do it.
I swore I'd get through this, so I could spend my vacation with Elisanne!
That's the spirit, Alex! Knock 'em dead out there! Just...not so dead they can't reach their wallets.
Oh, my fork!
Close one there. I managed to catch it before it hit the ground.
Whoa, you are FAST! Thank you.
I'm just glad I could help.
Do take your time and enjoy your meal.
*sigh* Entertaining people like this is hard. Did I smile right...?
You were PERFECT, Alex. Take a look at what your customers are out there saying!
Get this, people: Alex served me here at this cafe, and she knocked my socks off! Which is crazy, because I'm wearing sandals!
She has this whole stoic-meets-stylish vibe going, but she also gave me a shy smile! The girl's multitalented as heck!
Seriously? I have GOT to get in on that. 'Scuse me, pardon me, coming through!
Welcome, WELCOME! Table for one? Right this way!
Well, that seems good. I'll keep this up, then!
Well done today, both of you. You had crowds coming in droves!
Now, to announce the winner of our little contest for Best Barker in the Business...
I've tallied the number of customers you each brought in, and survey says... it's a draw!
A draw? But then what happens with the villa you said you'd let me borrow?
Yes, well, the condition was whether or not you WON in the competition...
Hrk...
But both of you did splendid work—so much that I couldn't possibly say which of you is better as a barker.
And as such, today, you're BOTH winners!
Yep, that checks out. I run this joint, after all!
But you gave some seriously wonderful service to those customers, Alex. I'm more than okay with this outcome!
Amane's right. You worked really hard, Alex, so as promised, my villa is yours!
Really? I truly owe you, Nina!
Finally, we can get this trip back on track!
It's just you, me, and the beach at last. I couldn't ask for anything better. Ahhh...
I'm glad you're happy, Alex. But, er... Why do you have that bow with you?
Oh, this? Think of it as...extra security.
(A must, considering what she told me.)
Alex, I do have one warning about this particular villa...
Fiends miiiiight attack from the ocean while you're on the private beach. So do be careful.
...I'm sorry?
You know, fiends? Evil and full of juicy bits? The place where the villa is located tends to have an outbreak every few years.
And once they show up, it means trouble... but hey, it doesn't happen all that much, so I'm sure it's fine! Probably.
(Unbelievable. We finally got away from people, only to possibly have FIENDS descend upon us?)
(I brought a weapon just in case, but I do hope I don't end up having to use it.)
(Tch! Speak of the devils...)
(Fortunately, Elisanne has her back turned to them and hasn't noticed yet—meaning I can do THIS!)
Elisanne! Look, up in the sky! What the hell is that?!
What?! What is it?!
Hah!
(There we go. If Elisanne had noticed the fiends, she would've started to think vacationing was out of the question.)
Er... I'm not seeing anything, Alex.
Sorry. Must've been my eyes playing tricks on me.
?! Elisanne, get down! Something's flying this way!
What?!
Hrah!
It DID feel like something whooshed over my head there...
Although I have to say, it sounded more like whatever it was came from your direction than somewhere else.
Oh, um, yeah... That's because it was coming from behind me, aiming for you.
Wow. You've got fantastic senses if you picked up on something in your blind spot like that.
Totally. I'm always on the lookout for these sorts of things.
Again?! Elisanne, um... Close your eyes! I've got a bad feeling the wind is going to kick sand into them!
Okay.
Yaaah!
...You're secretly fighting fiends, aren't you?
Ngh! You opened your eyes?!
I knew something weird was going on. Honestly, you are an AWFUL liar, Alex.
Urgh... I'm sorry. I thought that if you realized there were fiends afoot, you'd pull the plug on our vacation.
I see. It means a lot that you'd put so much effort into making me happy...
...but I really wish you'd stop pushing yourself so hard to do everything alone.
I barely broke a sweat, though.
That's not what I mean, Alex.
Fiends again?! We'll talk after we mop them up!
Right. I've had enough interruptions for one day.
Hrk... There're too many of them!
This is bad. Some of them got away, and they're headed for a beach with lots of people on it!
After them, Elisanne!
Eeeek! Fiends!
HEEEELP!
It's total chaos. We run the risk of hurting bystanders if we charge in headfirst.
First, we need to evacuate the area. Heeey! Run for the square over that way!
It's no good. They're so panicked, they're not hearing me!
Huh? Isn't that Alex?
It is! Surely she'll be able to help us like she did back at the contest!
Why are they focused on ME?!
No, this is perfect. You can use this opportunity to make them listen to you!
Oh, yeah, you're right! Okay!
(This'll be just like when I brought people into the cafe. Just be amiable like then, and...)
You have nothing to fear, friends! I promise you, I will defeat these fiends.
But to do that, I need you all to evacuate to the square in a calm and orderly fashion!
Whatever you say, Alex! We trust you!
Excellent. Now we can fight without worry. Haaah!
Ngh... I'm surrounded!
Hold strong, Elisanne! Hraaah!
Much appreciated.
Back-to-back formation, Elisanne. Let's clean this mess up once and for all.
Yeah! Together, Alex!
Haaaah!
And that looks like all of them.
Thank you so much, Alex!
Our beach is saved thanks to you!
Al-ex! Al-ex!
Let's sing our summertime savior's praises as we toss her into the air!
Hold on, now! I'd really rather you didn't—
Gah! I've heard the phrase ＂the crowd goes wild,＂ but this is ridiculous.
Let's run for the villa!
Come out, Alex! Let us thank you!
The whole villa's surrounded by rabid Alex fans. This sure is, uh, a thing.
She'll be mobbed in a flash if she so much as steps a toe outside.
With the throngs this thick, the people are liable to flood onto the private beach any second.
I can't believe this... This villa was my last ray of hope.
So much for our vacation.
Oh, Alex...
It doesn't seem like the crowd has any intention of dispersing.
I hate to say it, but I think our only recourse is to pack it up and head home.
If I stick around here, I'm going to end up making trouble for all our friends.
But—
Do me a favor, Elisanne. Try to have at least SOME fun, even if you have to do it alone.
Wait! Alex!
Let me go. I'm nothing but a burden here.
No, you're not. I've come up with a plan.
Really...?
Yes. But it'll be tough to pull off alone. At the very least, I'll need three people.
Nina? Amane? I hate to ask, but could you help us?
Gladly. Alex helped me make a killing, after all.
I'm in, too! How could I call myself a barker if I ignored two folks right here in desperate need of a vacation?
Much obliged. With that settled, here's what I need the two of you to do...
Hey! Someone's coming out!
Okay, but who am I looking at? Is that Alex in disguise?
At least one of them has to be the real Alex, right?
Hey, waaait! Alex! We want to thank you for saving the beach!
Now's my chance!
Elisanne's late. I hope she's okay.
Sorry to keep you waiting.
There you are! What a relief. You managed to give the fans the slip, I take it?
I did. The three of us used our disguises to lure the crowd and split them apart.
It took longer than I expected, but I'd call the plan a rousing success.
Thank you. You put yourselves at risk for my sake. It means a lot.
What are you talking about? You're the one who took risks for ME to begin with.
You took a job outside of your wheelhouse at the cafe, you tried to beat all the fiends at the beach by yourself...
That reminds me. Do you remember how I told you that you were trying to do too much by yourself?
Yeah. Now that you mention it, with everything that happened, I forgot to ask what you were getting at.
What I wanted to say was that there's no need for you and you ALONE to do so much. I'm here too, you know.
The desire to enjoy a relaxing vacation together runs both ways. And I was ready to work for it.
That's why I'm delighted that I could be helpful to you too with what we just did.
Elisanne...! I had no idea. Thank you so much, truly.
You can thank me by putting some sunscreen on and enjoying the rest of this day. Do we have a deal?
But of course!
This is everything I could've hoped for. Here's to making new summer memories!
Take that! And that! Well? Ready to cry uncle?
Eeek, cold! But two can play that game. Here's your PAYBACK!
WhoaBLBLBBBT! Impressive, Elisanne!
I could say the same of you, Alex!
Ha ha ha!
Hee hee hee!
A little more to the left! ...Agh, too far!
Here, then?
Yes! There! Swing down!
Agh, close! Barely grazed it!
I had no idea watermelon splitting was this hard. Your days are numbered, you green-and-pink menace. Let's go again!
Phew. I'm a little tired out.
We've been playing around for quite a while! Let's take a break.
Good idea.
The sound of the waves is so nice. There's something calming about the sea.
It hasn't been easy for any of us lately. You deserve to soak it all in, Alex.
Vacations aren't just about high-energy antics—they're also about taking time to recuperate, both in body and mind.
It sounds like I'm hitting all the marks, then.
I'm...so happy. Hanging out with you until we're both spent, then sitting together in peaceful repose...
I'm never going to forget this summer... Not so long as I...live...
Huh? Alex?
Zzz...zzz...
She fell asleep. And no wonder. It's about time she let herself breathe.
Even her sleeping face looks happy. Hee hee.
It does my heart good to see you making summer memories at long last, Alex. You deserve this. This and so much more.
